column4: I have an external hard drive that came from my windows system. its fat32 and was really fragmented. windows hated trying to defrag it (surprise surprise). is there anyway I can defrag it in ubuntu?
yes, I understand linux prevents fragmentation, but the drive was fragmented before being moved to Linux
back everything up on it, wipe it out, copy back the backup all at once.
hey it works :).  I myself am unaware of any defrag utilities in Linux for fat32
